ch.unibe.iam.graph.misc
Class SequentialIdMapper

java.lang.Object
  ch.unibe.iam.graph.misc.SequentialIdMapper
public class SequentialIdMapper
extends java.lang.Object

Maps the ID of an existing graph element in GINT to a new integer ID. The new ID will be assigned in sequence starting with startID (i.e., startID, startID + 1, startID + 2, startID + 3, ...).

Version:
$Revision: 1.4 $ $Date: 2004/05/14 15:31:30 $
Author:
Pascal Habegger

Constructor Summary
SequentialIdMapper(int pSizeMappings)
          Creates a new SequentialIdMapper which will start with ID 1.
SequentialIdMapper(int pSizeMappings, int pStartId)
          Creates new SequentialIdMapper

          returns true if the mode of the mapper is readonly, that is no new ids can be added

Method Detail

getAssignedId

public int getAssignedId(int pOriginalId)
Gets the new ID assigned to the graph element with the specified ID. If no assignment has been made so far, the specified ID will be mapped to the next free ID in sequence.

Parameters:
pOriginalId - Original ID of graph element.
Returns:
New (=assigned) ID of original graph element.

getOriginalId

public int getOriginalId(int pAssignedId)
Gets the original ID of a graph element with the specified assigned ID. If no assignment has been made, -1 will be returned.

Parameters:
pAssignedId - Assigned ID of graph element.
Returns:
Original ID of graph element or -1 if not found.

isReadOnly

public boolean isReadOnly()
returns true if the mode of the mapper is readonly, that is no new ids can be added

Returns:
true if the mapper is readonly

isReadWrite

public boolean isReadWrite()
returns true if the mode of the mapper is readwrite, that is new ids can be added

Returns:
true if the mapper is readwrite

setReadOnly

public void setReadOnly()
sets the mapper to readonly access

setReadWrite

public void setReadWrite()
sets the mapper to readwrite access
